page.title: 10PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: There is only one public house in this area, the Stags Head at Burwell on the A16. It is an old coaching house and still has 6 stables at the back. Beside the pub is an old "buttercross" where products were sold on market day. It is a busy little pub with a lot of regular customers most of whom travel from outside the "local" area. It is especially busy in the summer when visitors to the east coast pass through. In the pub there are stockcar medals won by one of the landlords friends at Skegness Stadium. The landlord sponsors him. The pub is decorated with various antiques including old cart wheels and of course a stag's head.
